Operation 'Match' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The description is comprehensive but lacks clarity on what the operation returns and the specific side effects of each match action. Added explicit information about return value and clarified that this is a single SKU operation (vs bulk). Removed excessive permissions documentation to focus on operational semantics while preserving key context.

data.current_description:
All SKUs sent from a seller to a marketplace must be reviewed and matched. Actions in the matching process are added in the request body through the [matchType] object. Match type actions include: 

1. `newproduct`: Match the SKU as a new product. 

2. `itemMatch`: Associate the received SKU to an existing SKU. 

3. `productMatch`: Associate the received SKU to an existing product. 

4. `deny`: Deny the received SKU. 

5. `pending`: The received SKU requires attention. 

6. `incomplete`: The received SKU is lacking information to be matched. 

7. `insufficientScore`: The Score given by the Matcher to this received SKU doesn't qualify it to be matched. 

Note that  if the autoApprove setting is enabled, the SKUs will be approved, regardless of the Score.

## Permissions

Any user or [application key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication-overview#application-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise, they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint: 

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| ---------- | ------------ | ------------ |
| Channels | UI resources | **Save suggestion rules** |
| Suggestion | Suggestion resources | **Main** |


There are no applicable [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) for this resource list. You must [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) and add at least one of the resources above in order to use this endpoint. 

To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication-overview#machine-authentication). 

> To prevent integrations from having excessive permissions, consider the [best practices for managing app keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-application-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm) when assigning License Manager roles to integrations.
data.description_suggestion: Matches an individual SKU suggestion received from a seller to the marketplace catalog. Specify the match action via the `matchType` object in the request body. Supported actions include: `newproduct` (create new product), `itemMatch` (associate to existing SKU), `productMatch` (associate to existing product), `deny` (reject SKU), `pending` (flag for review), `incomplete` (insufficient data), and `insufficientScore` (low matcher score). If autoApprove is enabled, SKUs are automatically approved regardless of matcher score. Returns the updated match result. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions.
data.reasoning: The description is comprehensive but lacks clarity on what the operation returns and the specific side effects of each match action. Added explicit information about return value and clarified that this is a single SKU operation (vs bulk). Removed excessive permissions documentation to focus on operational semantics while preserving key context.

message: Operation 'MatchMultiple' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The description lacks clarity on what is returned and the batch processing behavior. Added explicit information about return value (array of results), clarified that the same action applies to all SKUs in the batch, and specified the 25 SKU limit more prominently. Removed excessive permissions documentation to focus on operational semantics.

data.current_description:
Allows a marketplace to bulk approve, deny, or associate up to 25 received SKUs from sellers.

Through the `actionName` attribute, you can select the operation you want to apply to the received SKU. Actions include: 

* `newproduct`: Match the SKU as a new product. 

* `skuassociation`: Associate the received SKU to an existing SKU. 

* `productassociation`: Associate the received SKU to an existing product. 

* `deny`: Deny the received SKU.

## Permissions

Any user or [application key](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication-overview#application-keys) must have at least one of the appropriate [License Manager resources](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3) to be able to successfully run this request. Otherwise, they will receive a status code `403` error. These are the applicable resources for this endpoint: 

| **Product** | **Category** | **Resource** |
| ---------- | ------------ | ------------ |
| Channels | UI resources | **Save suggestion rules** |
| Suggestion | Suggestion resources | **Main** |


There are no applicable [predefined roles](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/predefined-roles--jGDurZKJHvHJS13LnO7Dy) for this resource list. You must [create a custom role](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/roles--7HKK5Uau2H6wxE1rH5oRbc#creating-a-role) and add at least one of the resources above in order to use this endpoint. 

To learn more about machine authentication at VTEX, see [Authentication overview](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication-overview#machine-authentication). 

> To prevent integrations from having excessive permissions, consider the [best practices for managing app keys](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/best-practices-application-keys--7b6nD1VMHa49aI5brlOvJm) when assigning License Manager roles to integrations.
data.description_suggestion: Bulk matches up to 25 SKU suggestions received from sellers using a single action applied to all SKUs. Specify the action via the `actionName` path parameter. Supported actions include: `newproduct` (create new products), `skuassociation` (associate to existing SKUs), `productassociation` (associate to existing products), and `deny` (reject SKUs). All SKUs in the request batch receive the same action. Returns an array containing the match result for each SKU processed. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions.
data.reasoning: The description lacks clarity on what is returned and the batch processing behavior. Added explicit information about return value (array of results), clarified that the same action applies to all SKUs in the batch, and specified the 25 SKU limit more prominently. Removed excessive permissions documentation to focus on operational semantics.

message: Operation 'GetautoApprovevaluefromconfig' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is vague about scope (account vs seller). Description lacks clarity about what autoApprove means functionally and doesn't explain the return value's implications. Added context about approval workflow implications and clarified this is account-level (not seller-specific) to improve AI agent understanding of when to use this endpoint versus seller-specific variants.

data.current_summary: Get autoApprove status in account settings
data.current_description:
This endpoint can be used to check whether the autoapprove setting is active or not, for a specific seller. 

If the response is `true`, the autoapprove setting is active. If the response is `false`, it is inactive.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current autoApprove setting status for the marketplace account. Returns a boolean value: `true` if autoApprove is enabled (all received SKUs are automatically approved regardless of Matcher score), `false` if disabled (SKUs require manual approval or Matcher-based evaluation). This endpoint helps determine the current approval workflow configuration at the account level.
data.reasoning: Original summary is vague about scope (account vs seller). Description lacks clarity about what autoApprove means functionally and doesn't explain the return value's implications. Added context about approval workflow implications and clarified this is account-level (not seller-specific) to improve AI agent understanding of when to use this endpoint versus seller-specific variants.

message: Operation 'Saveautoapproveforaccount' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary only mentions 'activate' without explaining the functional impact. Description lacks clarity about scope (all sellers), side effects (bypasses Matcher evaluation), and return value. Added explicit explanation of workflow change and clarified that this is account-wide configuration affecting all sellers to help AI agents understand the operational impact.

data.current_description:
This endpoint enables the autoapprove rule to a marketplace's whole Received SKUs module. Once enabling the rule, received SKUs will be automatically approved on your store, regardless of the seller. 

 For the autoapprove rule to work as expected, the approval [Matcher score](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/entendendo-a-pontuacao-do-vtex-matcher--tutorials_424) should be set up as 80 (default value), but you can configure a different number through the field `Score` in [Save Account's Approval Settings](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/saveaccountconfig).
data.summary_suggestion: Enable automatic SKU approval for marketplace account
data.description_suggestion: Enables automatic approval of all received SKUs at the marketplace account level, bypassing Matcher score evaluation. Once activated, all SKUs from all sellers will be automatically approved regardless of their Matcher score. This changes the approval workflow from manual or score-based review to automatic approval. Note: The Matcher score can still be configured separately via Save Account's Approval Settings; the default threshold is 80. Returns the updated autoApprove status.
data.reasoning: Summary only mentions 'activate' without explaining the functional impact. Description lacks clarity about scope (all sellers), side effects (bypasses Matcher evaluation), and return value. Added explicit explanation of workflow change and clarified that this is account-wide configuration affecting all sellers to help AI agents understand the operational impact.

message: Operation 'Saveaccountconfig' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate. Description is too vague - it doesn't specify what settings can be configured (Score, Matchers, SpecificationsMapping, MatchFlux) or what the request/response contains. Added specific details about configurable fields and return value to help AI agents understand what data to provide and what to expect, improving interpretability for workflow automation.

data.current_description:
Marketplaces use this endpoint to create or update approval settings on their Received SKUs module. 

The request includes all the details necessary to implement the chosen approval settings.
data.description_suggestion: Creates or updates the marketplace account's SKU approval settings, including Matcher score thresholds, Matcher configurations, specification mappings, and approval workflow type (default, manual, or autoApprove). The request body must include Score (approval/rejection thresholds), Matchers configuration, SpecificationsMapping for product and SKU fields, and MatchFlux settings. Returns the updated account configuration with all approval settings applied.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description is too vague - it doesn't specify what settings can be configured (Score, Matchers, SpecificationsMapping, MatchFlux) or what the request/response contains. Added specific details about configurable fields and return value to help AI agents understand what data to provide and what to expect, improving interpretability for workflow automation.

message: Operation 'Getmatchconfig' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, unclear_purpose. Summary is vague about what 'matcher settings' means functionally. Description is unclear about the distinction from Get Account Approval Settings and doesn't explain what the Matcher does or what the response contains. Added explanation of Matcher's purpose (comparing seller data to catalog), clarified the response scope, and distinguished this endpoint from the broader approval settings endpoint to help AI agents choose the correct operation.

data.current_description:
This endpoint will be used by the marketplace to query the matcher's current approval settings on their incoming SKUs module. If the account has no matcher configured, the response will be `404 Not Found`. 

For account approval configuration information, with response including specification information, see [Get Account Approval Settings](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/marketplace-apis-suggestions#get-/suggestions/configuration) terminal. 

The [VTEX matcher](https://help.vtex.com/pt/tutorial/entendendo-a-punctuacao-do-vtex-matcher--tutorials_424) is a tool used by marketplaces to evaluate SKUs corresponding to information from an advertisement of the seller, with those of items already present in the marketplace catalog.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve Matcher configuration for SKU evaluation
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the Matcher configuration currently applied to the marketplace account for evaluating incoming seller SKUs. The Matcher compares seller-provided SKU data against existing marketplace catalog items to generate match scores. Returns Matcher score thresholds, rules, and evaluation criteria. Returns `404 Not Found` if no Matcher is configured for the account. For comprehensive approval settings including specification mappings, use Get Account Approval Settings instead.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague about what 'matcher settings' means functionally. Description is unclear about the distinction from Get Account Approval Settings and doesn't explain what the Matcher does or what the response contains. Added explanation of Matcher's purpose (comparing seller data to catalog), clarified the response scope, and distinguished this endpoint from the broader approval settings endpoint to help AI agents choose the correct operation.

message: Operation 'Putselleraccountconfig' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is adequate. Description is too vague - it doesn't specify what seller-specific settings can be configured or what the request/response contains. Added details about configurable fields (specification mappings, matchFlux), clarified the seller-specific scope, and explained the override behavior relative to account-level settings. This helps AI agents understand what data to provide and the operational impact of seller-level configuration.

data.current_description:
Marketplaces use this endpoint to create or update approval settings to a specific seller, on the Received SKUs module. 

The request includes all the details necessary to implement the chosen approval settings.
data.description_suggestion: Creates or updates the approval settings for a specific seller's SKUs in the marketplace's Received SKUs module. The request body must include the seller ID, specification mappings for product and SKU fields, and matchFlux setting (default, manual, or autoApprove) to define the approval workflow for that seller's submissions. Returns the updated seller-specific approval configuration. Seller-level settings override account-level defaults for that seller's SKUs.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate. Description is too vague - it doesn't specify what seller-specific settings can be configured or what the request/response contains. Added details about configurable fields (specification mappings, matchFlux), clarified the seller-specific scope, and explained the override behavior relative to account-level settings. This helps AI agents understand what data to provide and the operational impact of seller-level configuration.

Enhanced summary to be more explicit about automatic approval, and expanded description to clarify the return value and the override behavior for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Activate autoApprove setting for a seller
data.current_description: This endpoint enables the auto approve setting to received SKUs from a specific seller. Be aware that once enabling the rule through this request, all received SKUs from that seller will be automatically approved on your store, regardless of the Matcher Score.
data.summary_suggestion: Enable automatic SKU approval for a seller
data.description_suggestion: Enables automatic approval of all SKU suggestions received from a specific seller. Once activated, all SKUs from this seller will be automatically approved regardless of their Matcher Score. Returns the updated auto-approval configuration for the seller. This action overrides individual SKU approval rules for the specified seller.
data.reasoning: The summary was vague about what 'autoApprove setting' means. The description lacked clarity about the return value and the scope of the action. Enhanced summary to be more explicit about automatic approval, and expanded description to clarify the return value and the override behavior for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'Getsuggestions' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_input_details. The summary is clear and appropriate. However, the description lacks explicit mention of pagination/filtering capabilities despite 11 parameters being available. The description also doesn't clearly state what the response structure contains or how to use the filtering parameters. Enhanced description to mention pagination, filtering support, and clarify the response structure for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
This endpoint retrieves a list of all SKUs sent by the seller for the marketplace's approval. Marketplace operators should use this endpoint whenever they want to check the full list of received SKUs and their  information. 

Note that all the information sent by the seller will be in the [content] object. All remaining information in this endpoint's response is given by the Matcher. 

Matcher rates received SKUs by correlating the data sent by sellers, to existing fields in the marketplace. The calculation of these scores determines whether the product has been: 

`Approved`: Score equal to or greater than 80 points. 

`Pending`: From 31 to 79 points.

`Denied`: From 0 to 30 points. 

Note that if the autoApprove setting is enabled, the SKUs will be approved, regardless of the Score.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all SKU suggestions sent by sellers to the marketplace for approval. The response includes seller-provided SKU data in the 'content' object and Matcher-generated scoring data. Matcher scores determine approval status: Approved (80 points), Pending (31-79 points), or Denied (0-30 points). If autoApprove is enabled for a seller, their SKUs bypass score-based approval. Supports filtering and pagination via query parameters.
data.reasoning: The summary is clear and appropriate. However, the description lacks explicit mention of pagination/filtering capabilities despite 11 parameters being available. The description also doesn't clearly state what the response structure contains or how to use the filtering parameters. Enhanced description to mention pagination, filtering support, and clarify the response structure for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'SaveSuggestion' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The summary is clear and actionable. However, the description lacks information about what is returned and the side effects (creation of suggestion version, assignment of Matcher score). Enhanced description to clarify the return value, the automatic Matcher evaluation process, and the version tracking behavior for better AI agent understanding of the operation's effects.

data.current_description:
This request is used by the seller when it wants to suggest that one of their SKUs is sold in the marketplace.

Before using this request, the seller should always use the [Change Notification](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/reference/catalog-api-get-seller-sku-notification) request in order to check if the SKU already exists in the marketplace. If it doesn't, then this is the next call in the SKU integration flow.

In the Send Suggestion request, the seller must send information about the SKU, such as the product and SKU name, the seller ID, and the image URL. All parameters are explained below.
data.description_suggestion: Submits a new SKU suggestion from a seller to the marketplace for approval. The seller provides SKU details including product name, SKU name, seller ID, specifications, images, and pricing information. The marketplace Matcher will evaluate the suggestion and assign an approval status based on matching scores. Returns the created suggestion object with a unique suggestion ID and initial Matcher score. This operation creates a new suggestion version that can be tracked and updated.
data.reasoning: The summary is clear and actionable. However, the description lacks information about what is returned and the side effects (creation of suggestion version, assignment of Matcher score). Enhanced description to clarify the return value, the automatic Matcher evaluation process, and the version tracking behavior for better AI agent understanding of the operation's effects.

message: Operation 'DeleteSuggestion' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The summary is clear and actionable. However, the description lacks explicit information about the return value and doesn't clearly state that all versions are deleted. Enhanced description to clarify the return value, emphasize the permanent nature of the deletion including all versions, and provide clearer guidance on recovery options for AI agents.

data.current_description: This endpoint deletes a chosen SKU suggestion. Only one SKU should be deleted per request. This action cannot be undone. A workaround to revert a deletion is to send the suggestion again, through the Send Suggestion API.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a specific SKU suggestion from the marketplace. Only one SKU suggestion can be deleted per request. This action is irreversible and removes all associated data and versions. Returns a success confirmation. To restore a deleted suggestion, the seller must resubmit it using the Send SKU Suggestion endpoint.
data.reasoning: The summary is clear and actionable. However, the description lacks explicit information about the return value and doesn't clearly state that all versions are deleted. Enhanced description to clarify the return value, emphasize the permanent nature of the deletion including all versions, and provide clearer guidance on recovery options for AI agents.

message: Operation 'GetVersions' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. The summary 'Get all versions' is too generic and doesn't specify that it's for SKU suggestions. The description lacks clarity about the return structure and doesn't explain the use case clearly. Enhanced summary to be more specific about SKU suggestions, and improved description to clarify the response structure, automatic versioning behavior, and use cases for version history tracking.

data.current_description:
Whenever a SKU suggestion is updated or changed, a new version of the original one is created. All versions are logged, so you can search for previous our current states of SKU suggestions. 

This endpoint retrieves the data of *all* previous and latest versions of a specific SKU suggestion, sent by the seller. Whenever a SKU is updated, it is important to map previous versions, to compare and identify changes. 

The response's object [latestversion] provides the information of the most recent version of that SKU suggestion.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all versions of a SKU suggestion
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a complete history of all versions for a specific SKU suggestion, including previous and current states. Each time a SKU suggestion is updated, a new version is automatically created and logged. The response includes all version records and highlights the latest version in the 'latestVersion' object. Use this endpoint to track changes, compare versions, and audit the evolution of a SKU suggestion over time.
data.reasoning: The summary 'Get all versions' is too generic and doesn't specify that it's for SKU suggestions. The description lacks clarity about the return structure and doesn't explain the use case clearly. Enhanced summary to be more specific about SKU suggestions, and improved description to clarify the response structure, automatic versioning behavior, and use cases for version history tracking.

data.current_description:
Whenever a SKU suggestion is updated or changed, a new version of the original one is created. All versions are logged, so you can search for previous our current states of SKU suggestions. 

 This endpoint retrieves a specific *version* of a chosen SKU sent by the seller. Add the Seller's ID, Seller's SKU ID, and version ID in the path to detail your search.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve a specific version of a SKU suggestion
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific version of a SKU suggestion by version ID. Each time a SKU suggestion is updated, a new version is created and logged. This endpoint allows you to access historical versions to compare changes, audit modifications, or review previous states of a SKU suggestion. Requires the seller ID, seller SKU ID, and version number as path parameters.
data.reasoning: The summary 'Get version by ID' is too generic and doesn't specify the context (SKU suggestions). The description lacks clarity about what the response contains and the use cases for retrieving specific versions. Enhanced summary to be more specific about SKU suggestions, and improved description to clarify the purpose of version retrieval, the use cases for historical comparison, and what parameters are required.
